element.name: Trauma Triage Criteria (High Risk for Serious Injury)
element.definition: Trauma triage criteria for the red boxes (Injury Patterns and Mental Status and Vital Signs) in the 2021 ACS National Guideline for the Field Triage of Injured Patients.
element.v3Comment: 2021 National Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients - Red Criteria (i.e., Injury Patterns, Mental Status & Vital Signs)
element.v3Changes: Revised to represent the 2021 National Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients - Red Criteria. Website: https://www.facs.org/quality-programs/trauma/systems/field-triage-guidelines/

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Amputation proximal to wrist or ankle

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Crushed, degloved, mangled, or pulseless extremity

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Chest wall instability, deformity, or suspected flail chest

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Penetrating injuries to head, neck, torso, and proximal extremities

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Respiratory Rate <10 or >29 breaths per minute (<20 in infants aged <1 year) or need for ventilatory support (DEPRECATED)

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Suspected fracture of two or more proximal long bones

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Active bleeding requiring a tourniquet or wound packing with continuous pressure

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Age 0-9 years: SBP < 70mm Hg + (2 x age in years)

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Respiratory distress or need for respiratory support

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Suspected spinal injury with new motor or sensory loss

asserts.assert: Trauma Triage Criteria (High Risk for Serious Injury) should only be recorded when Possible Injury is "Yes".
When Trauma Triage Criteria (High Risk for Serious Injury) has a Pertinent Negative, it should be empty and it should not have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting).
When Trauma Triage Criteria (High Risk for Serious Injury) has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When Trauma Triage Criteria (High Risk for Serious Injury) is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
When Trauma Triage Criteria (High Risk for Serious Injury) has a Not Value, no other value should be recorded.
When Trauma Triage Criteria (High Risk for Serious Injury) has a Pertinent Negative, no other value should be recorded.
